rot.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: to decay by a gradual natural process, or to make something do this
rot.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: The trees were cut and left to rot.
All the woodwork was rotting away.
rot.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: the natural process of decaying, or the part of something that has decayed
rot.translation[1].definitions[0].exampl: wood that is soft with rot
rot.translation[1].definitions[1].defini: a state in which something becomes bad or does not work as well as it should
rot.translation[1].definitions[1].exampl: He criticized the talk shows as ‘cultural rot’.
The team has enough good players to stop the rot.
It was after he left the company that the rot set in.
